alert.note: Alert for York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 7:54PM EDT until August 06 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, York. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... York, Parkville, Red Lion, Spry, Dallastown, Shiloh, East York, Stonybrook-Wilshire, West York, Shrewsbury, Codorus, Grantley, Tyler Run-Queens Gate, Valley View, Spring Grove, Stewartstown, Glen Rock, North York, Yorklyn and Jacobus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
